entry.tran: 道德上的极度拘谨；清心寡欲的思想
entry.def: Puritanism is behaviour or beliefs that are based on strict moral or religious principles, especially the principle that people should avoid physical pleasures.

example.ex: ...the tight-lipped puritanism of the Scottish literary world.
example.tran: 苏格兰文学界恪守的清教主义态度

means.word_mean: 1. the beliefs and practices characteristic of Puritans (most of whom were Calvinists who wished to purify the Church of England of its Catholic aspects)
2. strictness and austerity in conduct and religion
